forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 54, with temperatures falling to around 52 in the afternoon. West wind 7 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 44. North northwest wind 2 to 14 mph.

weather_report:
Downtown San Francisco greets us this afternoon with a mix of blue and elusive clouds, suggesting a predominantly sunny disposition despite the brisk air. A westward breeze carries the scents of the bay, invigorating yet tinged with a coolness that hints at the chill of evening. Temperature hovers around a mild 54, but watch as it dips slightly through the afternoon—an invitation to cozy up in layers rather than plunge into the day without thought. While driving winds may rustle the leaves, the fog remains at bay, allowing the cityscape—the spires and silhouettes of high-rises—to emerge distinctly against the lightening sky, although hints of the marine layer linger over the Golden Gate, teasing the hour with its soft presence.

As night settles in, low clouds will drift into view, lending the air an ethereal quality bathed in twilight. They'll welcome a nighttime temperature around 44, underscoring the need for a light jacket or a warm shawl to ward off the brisk air. It’s a splendid time to wander the quieter streets, perhaps searching for that little café that smells of roasting coffee or a bookshop where whispers of great tales beckon. Embrace a reflective stroll along the waterfront, where the calming sounds of the waves mingle with the city’s pulse, offering a moment of peace as the city transitions into a cooler embrace.
